intro: Scolymocephalus pendulus, commonly known as the hanging scolymus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hanging stems that bear small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Scolymocephalus pendulus is often used in herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
